column1: Why couldnt the toilet paper cross the road? because it was stuck in a crack!
column3: crack refers to a split or opening (toilet paper stuck in a crack) and can also refer to a type of substance (crack cocaine).
column4: The pot had a crack in it, causing water to leak out.
column5: The detective discovered a crack in the case that led to a breakthrough.

column1: What do you call a snake that likes history? a hissstorian.
column3: hiss refers to the sound a snake makes (hissstorian) and can also refer to a sound of disapproval or a warning.
column4: The snake made a loud hiss, startling the nearby birds.
column5: The audience began to hiss when the speaker made an unpopular statement.

column1: Whats the difference between a midget and a dwarf? very little!
column3: little refers to size (very little) and can also mean something insignificant.
column4: The cake was so little that we barely had enough for everyone.
column5: She felt little compared to her friends, who all seemed more accomplished.

column1: What did the cannibal do after he dumped his girlfriend? he flushed.
column3: flushed refers to the act of expelling waste (flushed) and can also refer to a state of embarrassment (flushed face).
column4: After the meal, he flushed the toilet to dispose of the waste.
column5: She felt flushed after receiving unexpected compliments during the meeting.
